datafield.subfield: Rural Housing and Community Development Service
Building dreams, the mutual self-help housing program, 1997:
t.p. (USDA Rural Development, Rural Housing Service)
Phone call by Lib. of Cong., to Office of Undersecretary, Rural Development, 09-16-97

(Rural Development was formerly called Rural Economic and Community Development; name changed in 1994, but was still not completely in effect in 1996; Rural Development is subdivided into 3 agencies or "mission areas": Rural Housing Service (responsible for the portion of the activities of the former Farmers Home Administration taken over by the former Rural and Economic Community Development), Rural Utilities Service, and Rural Business Service)
(Department of Agriculture; Rural Economic and Community Development, Under Secretary; Rural Housing [and] Community Development Services, Administrator)
(Department of Agriculture; Rural Development, Under Secretary; Rural Housing Services, Administrator)
Fed. register, 7 May 1997, accessed online, 21 Jan. 1999:
at top, at "Summary" (The Rural Housing Service, formerly Rural Housing and Community Development Service, a successor agency to the Farmers Home Administration)
